item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 12th June
item.description:
There has been an abandoned vehicle on the corner of Radnor Avenue and Tyrrell Avenue for a couple of months. No back number plate, Grey Honda . Reg RE56 ZVM. Vehicle is taking up a valuable parking spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tyrrell Avenue, Blackfen, London

item.title: Between tree and manhole cover a trip hazard, 12th June
item.description:

item.title: Slow down sign now working, 12th June
item.description:
The sign was knocked over by a van and now put back up but it doesn’t work! I don’t think it has worked for a while even before it was hit. It might help with slowing down cars along the road if it actually worked!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The wooden Bollard leaning forward and remains loose, 12th June
item.description:
The bollard is currently leaning forward and remains loose. Although it appears that a repair was previously attempted, the fix was not successful, as the bollard is still unstable and not securely in place. This bollard plays an important role in protecting the pavement from cars and vans parking too close, and it helps ensure a safe walkway for local residents. Could you please arrange for a proper repair to ensure the bollard is securely fixed? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Joan Crescent, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Distracting advert signs, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Drive, Charlton, London

item.title: Tree fallen into Kelsey Lane - unable to drive down the lane, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
